entries.text:
# Rupert’s PhD Graduation Ceremony

It’s March 2023 and while having tea with the parents we got talking about Afternoon Tea at smart hotels\.  Erica recalled the time we went to The Ritz for tea, it was for Rupert’s Phd ceremony\.

I couldn’t find the photos in my Mac Photos so set out to recover the memory \- as of May 2023 photos are recovered \. 

The day started with lunch at the Athenaeum\. 
Formal ceremony at The Royal Albert Hall
Tour around Rupert’s laboratory
Afternoon Tea at *The Ritz\.*

Really nice day\. 

![](dayone-moment://56F5314C3E3343DC9936138C56387338)

entries.text:
I broke my foot 
Living at World City Towers
On my way to work one fine day\.
At Hamamatsucho station I was descending the escalators to get to the Yamanoto line\. 
I slipped and hit my foot side on\. It hurt a little but was able to hobble to work\.

BUT \- during the day the pain in the foot started getting worse\. By lunch time I didn’t think I could walk more than a few meters without extreme pain\. I had cracked a bone for sure\.

Unable to use public transport Noriko drove the care \( Tiida\!\) to BNPP’s offices at Tokyo station and picked me up\.

No trip to ER, instead I went to see a bone doctor who x\-rayed and confirmed I had cracked a bone\.

Didn’t need a plaster but needed to keep the wait of the foot for a few days\.

![](dayone-moment://0625BCB16C6F4CE1B27E2BBFAD4A00CB)

entries.text:
# Takao Bike Ride losing Amir Ending at Hato’s Bar
*May 2023, recalling the adventurous bike ride to Takao\.* 

![](dayone-moment://3DC539B24DFB4D959F4A19EF138A47AE)

Heat exhaustion  \- take the trouser off cool of with just shorts\.
Arrive at Takao\. Simon and Paul bolt up the hill\. Alex and Paul chill at the foot of the mountain\.  

On the way home I learn I need a bright cycle light to properly illuminate the road ahead and see in the darkness\. As oppose to a weak flashy LED light that simply let’s others ’know you’re there’  

We loose Amir who’s phone had run out of batteries\.  We spent some hours looking for him only to find he got home ages ago and forgot to call in that he was fine\.   

Paul, Simon and I made it to Hato’s Bar in time to get a few fines ales and some delicious BBQ\.  

A fine boys day out\.

entries.text:
# Arrived in South Africa for Grand Safari and Ted & Fee’s wedding
first night dinner at Ted’s nice house

# Visiting Chigasaki Beach \- 茅ケ崎


Woke up early and took a train to Chigasaki ​*with the dog*​\!
On the train dog had to be in the carry bag\. 

Long walk from station to beach\.
Found a nice beach spot, played with the puppy \- she had full power \- sprinted around so fast\.

Had a fund morning until Leo got stung by jelly fish \- then we had a real stress to get the boy home\. He was in distress\. Mum had to run to a pharmacy to get any medication she could\.

Later that afternoon it was rain and thunder

![](dayone-moment://CC7C5AFF1CC24B37952A002225E837C1)

entries.text:
# Visiting Nijima

2013 the family, with dog, traveled to the island of Nijima\. 

![](dayone-moment://831E58AF8C6C46E881CEDF7A2139316A)

Hydrofoil boat from Takeshiba pier, short taxi ride 

Wifi but no internet\!

Kids were sick, dog was sick\.  

Fun on the beach\. 

Dog ran circles around me and I couldn’t catch her\.   

Lost my blackberry

entries.text:
# A ray of hope
On this day I got an email from Paul Harvey saying he’ll find me a job in London\.  

JEXIT was always the plan but from here on it was a reality\.   
\( March 2021 update while bored at my WFH desk\)

# Test 
Can I see green

"},{"text":"In my L6 year at King’s Bruton I shared a study with Byron Mordan and Tony KuPaKing.

Bad acne on my back
Byron singing Cantonese songs with Tony




Upper six room

Having porn put on my walls seconds before a room inspection 
I was busy checking everything else having got my room tidy.  Scores & Strevens and may be David Macalease. ?"}]}
entries.text:
# KSB \- Lower Sixth bedsit\.
In my L6 year at King’s Bruton I shared a study with Byron Mordan and Tony KuPaKing\.

Bad acne on my back
Byron singing Cantonese songs with Tony




Upper six room

Having porn put on my walls seconds before a room inspection 
I was busy checking everything else having got my room tidy\.  Scores & Strevens and may be David Macalease\. ?

"},{"text":"While working at SSB, the Shiodome office of BNPP , around 2012, Steve Donhou and o would drink beers at the Drunk Bears pub just opposite the office. (汐留シオサイト) "},{"attributes":{"linkURL":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiodome"},"text":"wikipedia link"},{"text":"

Occasionally we would by some beers from a conveni and drink the beers in the open air space between offices.  

Suri ( IRL Yadagiri Pushpagiri) and I would walk along the pedestrian skyway after lunch up to the The Nakagin Capsule Tower (中銀カプセルタワー)  "},{"attributes":{"linkURL":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakagin_Capsule_Tower"},"text":"wikipedia"},{"text":"

Loved the Singaporean prawn tofu dish at the near by Singaporean restaurant

various convenies
independent bakery

	"}]}
entries.text:
# Remembering BNPP’s Shiodome office
While working at SSB, the Shiodome office of BNPP , around 2012, Steve Donhou and o would drink beers at the Drunk Bears pub just opposite the office\. \(汐留シオサイト\) [wikipedia link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiodome)

Occasionally we would by some beers from a conveni and drink the beers in the open air space between offices\.  

Suri \( IRL Yadagiri Pushpagiri\) and I would walk along the pedestrian skyway after lunch up to the The Nakagin Capsule Tower \(中銀カプセルタワー\)  [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakagin_Capsule_Tower)

Loved the Singaporean prawn tofu dish at the near by Singaporean restaurant 

I loved the various Pan\-ya\-san bread shops that would buy my daily breakfast\.
Vie de France
various convenies
independent bakery

entries.text:
# Hordle House
Sports activity\- Running to the Tank Traps a mile or two from the cliff entrance to the school\. 

Seeing actual muck spreading happening in neighbouring field \- i\.e\. tractor pulls hug trailer of fermented cow pooh which is ejected from the trailer by thrashing chain\. If you’re down wind of this display it will stink \.\.\. of fermented cow pooh\.

Playing cricket for 1st time and being clueless\.  Not liking it\. 

Shooting team , being quite good, having my own gun\.  Getting my school colours\- to have a hordle boar 🐗 on my blazer jacket

entries.richText:
{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-ios","version":721}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"identifier":"C40B98C5-F441-41E0-929F-F25614F16F6F","header":1}},"text":"Visiting Syndey Australia 1997
"},{"text":"

First business class flight - top deck on a 747.  
Sunset in Bangkok airport, just a 45 minutebstop over before jetting further eastward to hit landfill of Australia.  ( Nearly there? Ha! Another 6 hours flying)


What prompted this? Seeing a photo of myself and Neil Khanchandani on a sailing boat in in Sydney harbour. 

"}]}
entries.text:
# Visiting Syndey Australia 1997


First business class flight \- top deck on a 747\.  
Sunset in Bangkok airport, just a 45 minutebstop over before jetting further eastward to hit landfill of Australia\.  \( Nearly there? Ha\! Another 6 hours flying\)


What prompted this? Seeing a photo of myself and Neil Khanchandani on a sailing boat in in Sydney harbour\.

entries.text:
# Fives \- the game the gloves
Fives was the game played at King’s School Bruton, a predecessor to modern Squash with similar rules\.

What can I remember?
It was less of a burden than the normal games like rugby 
it was quite enjoyable 
it was run by Paul Davies AKA Greeny

it hurt your hands especially on a cold day\.


![](dayone-moment://3F0E5E5FBAED48A78DCCB332448AF914)

photos.lensModel: iPhone 8 Plus back dual camera 3.99mm f/1.8

entries.richText:
{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-mac","version":1225}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"identifier":"640EBDFE-6607-4E1E-90A4-E11078BB1440","header":6}},"text":"Write about your first computer.
"},{"text":"VIC20, not the Commodore 64. The VIC had tape player for loading such awesome games as hoppit. But some games need an 8K ram booster, an additional purchase of some £30 or £40 pounds.

School, Hordle House that is, had ZX81s and ZX Spectrums. The ZX81 was hard work but the spectrum was an excellent device featuring reasonable Basic and games such as Elite. 

At high school, i.e Public School ie Kings School Bruton we got BBC Micro computers. These were more evolved devices. I remember the speech chip allowed the device to speak calling the command"},{"attributes":{},"text":" "},{"attributes":{"inlineCode":true},"text":"say."},{"attributes":{},"text":" "},{"text":"  Say ‘cheese’ say ‘pants’.. it was well programmed. No matter what combination of F.U.C.K it wouldn’t say the f-word. fu-youka was as about as close as we could get. Still it gave us experience of iterative solution methods ;-)

TRS-80 hand held computer

FX-7000G Graphical calculator during A-Levels was fun.

Psion 2 , Psion 3 and laterally the Psion 5 were all excellent devices I used in my early 20s.

There must be other gadgets out there. "}]}
entries.text:
###### Write about your first computer\.
VIC20, not the Commodore 64\. The VIC had tape player for loading such awesome games as hoppit\. But some games need an 8K ram booster, an additional purchase of some £30 or £40 pounds\.

School, Hordle House that is, had ZX81s and ZX Spectrums\. The ZX81 was hard work but the spectrum was an excellent device featuring reasonable Basic and games such as Elite\. 

At high school, i\.e Public School ie Kings School Bruton we got BBC Micro computers\. These were more evolved devices\. I remember the speech chip allowed the device to speak calling the command `say\.`   Say ‘cheese’ say ‘pants’\.\. it was well programmed\. No matter what combination of F\.U\.C\.K it wouldn’t say the f\-word\. fu\-youka was as about as close as we could get\. Still it gave us experience of iterative solution methods ;\-\)

TRS\-80 hand held computer

FX\-7000G Graphical calculator during A\-Levels was fun\.

Psion 2 , Psion 3 and laterally the Psion 5 were all excellent devices I used in my early 20s\.

There must be other gadgets out there\.

Fragment due to Noriko playing Hearts famous tracks and this memory popped in\.

"},{"text":"
I used to get terrible ear infections.  Especially after I first move to Japan in 2004. This little green bottle used to be a regular thing for me.  Holidays and everyday life  were disrupted as I had to make detours to doctors to get this prescription drug.

I became very practiced at the Japanese for I have an ear infection. Starting with the telephone reservation to se the JIBIKA (耳鼻科) then actually meeting the doctor, rapidly explaining  the situation and then of course go to the pharmacy (薬局) and presenting the prescription (処方 / しょほうせん) 

From my 40s I’ve been lucky and have had no more serious infections.  I’ve kept a bottle of this medicine in my wash bag for the times I feel a tingle in the ear and need to act early to avoid trouble. 

All over the world this ear medicine is a prescription drug.  Except in the Cebu in the Philippines. In January 2012 we took a family holiday to the Philippines. while wondering around the shopping maul near our hotel I walked into a Watson’s pharmacy on the off chance and got lucky. Stocked up 

"},{"attributes":{"line":{"identifier":"AAFAE10E-4F23-4278-A58C-0006A3C4AC54","header":2}},"text":"Watsons:
"},{"text":"Pharmacy as seen in Hong Kong and much of Asia.  Useful to stock up on western toiletries when visiting from Japan.. Deodorant and shower gel were always must buy items.

entries.text:
# タリビッド耳科用液

I used to get terrible ear infections\.  Especially after I first move to Japan in 2004\. This little green bottle used to be a regular thing for me\.  Holidays and everyday life  were disrupted as I had to make detours to doctors to get this prescription drug\.

I became very practiced at the Japanese for I have an ear infection\. Starting with the telephone reservation to se the JIBIKA \(耳鼻科\) then actually meeting the doctor, rapidly explaining  the situation and then of course go to the pharmacy \(薬局\) and presenting the prescription \(処方 / しょほうせん\) 

From my 40s I’ve been lucky and have had no more serious infections\.  I’ve kept a bottle of this medicine in my wash bag for the times I feel a tingle in the ear and need to act early to avoid trouble\. 

All over the world this ear medicine is a prescription drug\.  Except in the Cebu in the Philippines\. In January 2012 we took a family holiday to the Philippines\. while wondering around the shopping maul near our hotel I walked into a Watson’s pharmacy on the off chance and got lucky\. Stocked up 

## Watsons:
Pharmacy as seen in Hong Kong and much of Asia\.  Useful to stock up on western toiletries when visiting from Japan\.\. Deodorant and shower gel were always must buy items\.  



![](dayone-moment://D0D7A8787F7B48F8802753C5977E1AE0)

商品名：タリビッド耳科用液0\.3%
主成分：オフロキサシン（Ofloxacin）
剤形：微黄色〜淡黄色澄明の液剤

Active ingredient: Ofloxacin
Dosage form:slightly yellow to pale yellow clear solution

https://www\.rad\-ar\.or\.jp/siori/kekka\.cgi?n=48264
English info
https://www\.rad\-ar\.or\.jp/siori/english/kekka\.cgi?n=43755

entries.text:
# Starbucks in Vancouver

In the summer of 1993, after my second year at University I spent 3 months living in Vancouver, Canada\. Probably July to September


At the time Robin was working for a Vancouver based company, Pacific Asia, specialising in food packaging\. Roy Robinson, a co director of the company, invited me to come work in the Pac Asia office for the summer\. AWESOME\!

So why the Starbuck stickers? and why now?

Here in 2021, during the pandemic, I purchased a pack of House Blend SB coffee\. The smell of House Blend coffee took me back to the magical first moments of entering a Starbucks in West Coast America \( ahem, Canada\)\.

You could buy various blends of beans and each blend had it’s own sticker\. These were beautiful and collectable\. They now sit on the inside cover of my green diary\.

![](dayone-moment://2502287BA3FF4B339295F33C64A6A5F9)

entries.text:
# Hoover Dam

November 2nd 1995 I visited the Hoover Dam in Nevada\.

My first few years of living in London were difficult and mostly unhappy\. To give me a boost my parents invited me to join them on the final leg of their round\-the\-world trip\. We were to meet in Phoenix Arizona\. They were coming in from New Zealand and I was coming from London\.

The whole trip deserves it’s own entries
- Tapatio cliffs hotel \- desserts , cactus, stars at night \- so different so beautiful 
- Driving to Vegas across the dessert 
- Being in Vegas
- Driving to California and into ‘Frisco
- Wallet and cards stolen\!

Visiting the Dam \-on our way to Vegas\.
You probably can’t even visit the dam now what with terror and security\.
Our guide know everything *EVERYTHING* about the dam
I stood on the date line with one leg in Nevada  at 4:15pm and the other leg in Arizona at 5:15 or so some such\. One is Mountain Standard Time and the other is Pacific Standard Time\.


![](dayone-moment://BD0E3FAFFCE64004A7AEA8DB279CD9BB)

photos.lensModel: iPhone 8 Plus back dual camera 3.99mm f/1.8

entries.text:
# Travel Dates from my British Passport up to 30 March 2001

Original non standard shaped Blue passport\. Issued July 8th 1991 expired July 8 2001\.


# 1996
Arrived \- Istanbul Turkey \- 26\-Sep\-1996
Departed \- Istanbul Turkey \- 30\-Sep\-1996
# 1997
Arrived \- Tokyo Japan \- 30\-Mar\-1997
Departed Tokyo Japan  12\-Apr\-1997

Arrived Sydney Australia  10\-Oct\-1997
Departed Sydney Australia  17\-Dec\-1997
# 1998
Arrived New York 10\-Oct\-1998
# 1999
Arrived Sydney Australia  10\-Oct\-1999
Departed Cairns Australia 27\-Oct\-1999

Arrived \- Hong Kong 27\-Oct\-1999
Departed \- Hong Kong 29\-Oct\-1999

# 2000
Arrived \- Bangkok Thailand 03\-Dec\-2000 Flight BA10 
Departed \- Bangkok Thailand 09\-Dec\-2000 Flight BA11


Arrived \- Brisbane Australia 24\-Nov\-2000
Departed \-  Sydney Australia 02\-Dec\-2000

Arrived \- Tokyo Japan \- 5\-Nov\-2000
Departed  \- Tokyo Japan  15\-Nov\-2000

# 2001
Arrived \- Tokyo Japan 03\-Jan\-2001
Departed \-  Tokyo Japan 30\-Mar\-2001

"},{"text":"It’s a Thursday evening and I’m drinking a solitary beer that’s been stuck at the back of the fridge for some time.  It’s a white beer.  Not my everyday choice.

entries.text:
# Weiss bier in Brussels 
It’s a Thursday evening and I’m drinking a solitary beer that’s been stuck at the back of the fridge for some time\.  It’s a white beer\.  Not my everyday choice\.  

Sniffing the fragrance of the beer took me back to the late 90s when I visited Fran and Trevor in Brussels\.  

Craig and I would take the Eurostar from Waterloo as it was then and have a jolly good time wine and dinning with the expats\.  

What else can I recall of visiting Brussels with Craig and then Anne

entries.richText:
{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-ios","version":791}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"identifier":"B0798EDA-9BA9-44FD-AADD-6448900A877E","header":1}},"text":"Ales and BBQ at Hato’s Bar 
"},{"text":"
Somewhere in the back streets of Shibuya was Hato’s Bar.  This bar served low and slow smoked BBQ food and fine ales.  This style of food was new to Japan and enjoyed this place immensely.  

I guess I went there 4 to 5 times.  

On one occasion Reuters was buying.  Thank you Andy Cockburn for using your expense account. 

Another occasion I remember Paul, Simon, Amir and my self did a huge bike ride to Takao and back. This was before I got into road bikes so this was quite an escapade.  

On the way home we lost Amir who went home solo and didn’t tell us.  This was annoying and delayed our arrival at Hato. Thankfully they still had plenty of beer and some of their BBQ meats which were so well received after a full day cycling.  "}]}
entries.text:
# Ales and BBQ at Hato’s Bar 

Somewhere in the back streets of Shibuya was Hato’s Bar\.  This bar served low and slow smoked BBQ food and fine ales\.  This style of food was new to Japan and enjoyed this place immensely\.  

I guess I went there 4 to 5 times\.  

On one occasion Reuters was buying\.  Thank you Andy Cockburn for using your expense account\. 

Another occasion I remember Paul, Simon, Amir and my self did a huge bike ride to Takao and back\. This was before I got into road bikes so this was quite an escapade\.  

On the way home we lost Amir who went home solo and didn’t tell us\.  This was annoying and delayed our arrival at Hato\. Thankfully they still had plenty of beer and some of their BBQ meats which were so well received after a full day cycling\.

entries.richText:
{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-mac","version":1311}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"02D79A25-BF6E-440A-8A1B-8A9D9BBCE6BF"}},"text":"Ascend the stairs at GTNT
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"BF07C1CF-168A-409A-A8D4-276568B53285"}},"text":"
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"672C5FED-128F-4EF2-B4A3-D1FD7CDFE79B"}},"text":"
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"28A68ED7-9A9E-4247-9D62-3E0C5955E524"}},"text":"it was while I was an APS Manager but before 
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"F497C828-DE59-477B-BFC6-4708706148F2"}},"text":"I remember once at BNPP’s Tokyo office the lifts were out due to earthquake. 
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"A1F10A37-0DF7-4A47-B368-B040D140DA4A"}},"text":"Above a certain magnitude a human  inspection was required or  some such.. it was 8:30am and it was use the stairs or wait… 41floors. there were hundreds of staff waiting at ground level. Even if the lifts started now it would be 10-15 mins before I could be lifted. and  being a bank and IT support there was extreme pressure to get to your desk.. ( Mr Orr my then boss was quite clear on this) . because I used to hang out with these crazy fruitcake nut jobs [Simon, Paul and Joe] that hike around mountains a lot I was in good shape.. I knew I could go up the stairs, just had to keep a slow and steady pace.  It was with a huge sense of smugness that I arrived at level 41a little puffed but nothing more. Meanwhile the younger gungho trader who started the ascent with me tapped out to rest at level 30. A few others pushed thru but looked near heart attack [David Salle]  when the slumped on the floor at level 41.  Being fit feels great sometime…
"},{"text":"
I wish I used my Garmin watch to track the ascent but I remember thinking I’d rather a reliable watch then something running on batteries  so left the Garmin at home. 
"},{"attributes":{"line":{"header":0,"identifier":"672C5FED-128F-4EF2-B4A3-D1FD7CDFE79B"}},"text":"circa 2016 or 2017 - the trader was called Teddy, I was living in Azamino"}]}
entries.text:
Ascend the stairs at GTNT


it was while I was an APS Manager but before 
I remember once at BNPP’s Tokyo office the lifts were out due to earthquake\. 
Above a certain magnitude a human  inspection was required or  some such\.\. it was 8:30am and it was use the stairs or wait… 41floors\. there were hundreds of staff waiting at ground level\. Even if the lifts started now it would be 10\-15 mins before I could be lifted\. and  being a bank and IT support there was extreme pressure to get to your desk\.\. \( Mr Orr my then boss was quite clear on this\) \. because I used to hang out with these crazy fruitcake nut jobs \[Simon, Paul and Joe\] that hike around mountains a lot I was in good shape\.\. I knew I could go up the stairs, just had to keep a slow and steady pace\.  It was with a huge sense of smugness that I arrived at level 41a little puffed but nothing more\. Meanwhile the younger gungho trader who started the ascent with me tapped out to rest at level 30\. A few others pushed thru but looked near heart attack \[David Salle\]  when the slumped on the floor at level 41\.  Being fit feels great sometime…

I wish I used my Garmin watch to track the ascent but I remember thinking I’d rather a reliable watch then something running on batteries  so left the Garmin at home\. 
circa 2016 or 2017 \- the trader was called Teddy, I was living in Azamino

"},{"text":"
Today Robin chimed in in the Global Oultons WhatsApp group that it's was Rupert and Cassie's wedding anniversary. 

In Tokyo in 2009 I decided I could attend one but not birth wedding ceremonies.  I decided to attend the UK event and miss the California event. 

Betty 
Baby boy Leo


What's in my paper diary for this time?p"}]}
entries.text:
# Rupert and Cassie's wedding OTD 2009 

Today Robin chimed in in the Global Oultons WhatsApp group that it's was Rupert and Cassie's wedding anniversary\. 

In Tokyo in 2009 I decided I could attend one but not birth wedding ceremonies\.  I decided to attend the UK event and miss the California event\. 

Betty 
Baby boy Leo


What's in my paper diary for this time?p

entries.text:
# Apartments 33
What do I recall of my 2001 home in Shinagawa? I’m listening to Sash 
“Trilenium”  an Album I purchased on CD and enjoyed at that time\.  

Small but nice apartment 
Traveling to ohtemach, Shinagawa to Tokyo on the Yamanote line then walk to the sankei building 


### What my feelings 
Hope, exciting, a sense of achievement\- I had transitioned out of London and was in 東京‼️

Drinks at the Town Cryer




https://open\.spotify\.com/album/4B5SWZGra1EmEkl5PfEsGo?si=I\-2MreyBTa2hIv0TPqpzTQ


https://open\.spotify\.com/track/0Djs082SsuqlqGP9Mn91RC

?si=h6yP\_7eZSZSmMyMdE35jQg

entries.richText:
{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-ios","version":902}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"header":1,"identifier":"4E02EB77-B002-413E-9EFA-3902D30099AF"}},"text":"Shortest commute- Cycling from WCT to SSB 
"},{"text":"Tokyo, 2009 on wards 

Office was in Shiodome and I could cycle from home to office in just 18 minutes.  I became quite fit.  I got the occasional flat a long walk from anywhere.  

My while bike broke down, had to leave it at a yurikamomen station for a few days"}]}
entries.text:
# Shortest commute\- Cycling from WCT to SSB 
Tokyo, 2009 on wards 

Office was in Shiodome and I could cycle from home to office in just 18 minutes\.  I became quite fit\.  I got the occasional flat a long walk from anywhere\.  

My while bike broke down, had to leave it at a yurikamomen station for a few days

# Kourous
Ismir airport Turkey\.  We’ve just finished a lovely week long holiday and we’re heading home\. While waiting airside Hannah and I try out some perfumes for me\. She’s already doused her self with various smells\. 

Amidst the latest perfumes I see Yves Saint Laurent ‘Kouros’ perfume\.  I haven’t seen or smelt this since I was at King’s School Bruton back in the 1990’s 

I once had this perfume and enjoyed its smell\. At the time created a great affect on me\. What’s curious is smelling it now doesn’t invoke the memories I thought it would\.  

Thinking hard I have a faint memory of a collage I created\. A rectangular 30 x10 cm self made artwork with various 80s style bits n bobs arranged artistically behind a clear acrylic sheet\. It was a nice desktop decoration\.  There were no  desktop computers at this time, it would have been all paper save for my trust Casio FX 7000g graphical calculator\.  

I also tried the perfumes Higher Energy and Eau Sauvage\.  Hannah liked the later, thought it was fresh and very much my sort of smell\.

{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-mac","version":1416}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"header":1,"identifier":"FD2B89F2-61FD-4BC6-B9F1-AD3A7372DEB7"}},"text":"Kourous
"},{"text":"Ismir airport Turkey.  We’ve just finished a lovely week long holiday and we’re heading home. While waiting airside Hannah and I try out some perfumes for me. She’s already doused her self with various smells. 

Amidst the latest perfumes I see Yves Saint Laurent ‘Kouros’ perfume.  I haven’t seen or smelt this since I was at King’s School Bruton back in the 1990’s 

I once had this perfume and enjoyed its smell. At the time created a great affect on me. What’s curious is smelling it now doesn’t invoke the memories I thought it would.  

Thinking hard I have a faint memory of a collage I created. A rectangular 30 x10 cm self made artwork with various 80s style bits n bobs arranged artistically behind a clear acrylic sheet. It was a nice desktop decoration.  There were no  desktop computers at this time, it would have been all paper save for my trust Casio FX 7000g graphical calculator.  

I also tried the perfumes Higher Energy and Eau Sauvage.  Hannah liked the later, thought it was fresh and very much my sort of smell. "}]}

entries.text:
Deskfasts to remember 


Let us remember all the different places I would go get my breakfast on the way to work\.  

Starting at May West, catching the 25 bus with my hot pret coffee and hoping it stays hot until Aldgate East Black Lion House\. 


MKI breakfasts

Paribas breakfasts 
Bagels
Strong coffees 


Tokyo breakfast 
Shiodome

Posh ¥500 croissant from mitsu koshi\-mae

Perfect finger sandwich from yarsu mall

entries.richText:
{"meta":{"version":1,"small-lines-removed":true,"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-mac","version":1506}},"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"header":1,"identifier":"FCF68BA2-23E1-40CA-B6D5-A3F512A561D4"}},"text":"Delicious Wine
"},{"text":"
Last night at dinner Leo asked me the best wine I’ve ever drunk.  There wasn’t a simple answer, there’s many lovely wines I’ve had over the years but one moment did pop into my head.

Enjoying Japanese Chardonnay while flying to Mumbai. I was surprised I couldn’t find a diary entry on the topic.  Scanning my photos I found it happened in 2014 before I was properly practiced at writing in this diary.  

From 11th May 2014, flight NH943 to   ムンバイ
Lots of photos - check them out. 

Château Mercian Nitsuru Chardonnay 2006
Nitsuru, Fukushima
シャトー・メルシャン・新鶴・シャルドネ 2006
新鶴、福島

Citrus notes include grapefruit and lemon.
A gentle, calm wine rich in fruit. A supple, well-balanced finish is one of the many charms of this white wine in Japan's renowned Mercian flagship series.
Chardonnay

グレープフルーツやレモンのような柑橘系の香り。
果実味が豊かで、優しく穏やかな味わいです。
しなやかでバランスよい仕上がりが何よりもの魅力。
各国のコンクールで高い評価を獲得している
メルシャンのフラッグシップ・シリーズの白ワインです。
シャルドネ
"},{"embeddedObjects":[{"type":"photo","identifier":"F98C2F80845541C8A847546A30BCC0A3"}]}]}
entries.text:
# Delicious Wine

Last night at dinner Leo asked me the best wine I’ve ever drunk\.  There wasn’t a simple answer, there’s many lovely wines I’ve had over the years but one moment did pop into my head\.

Enjoying Japanese Chardonnay while flying to Mumbai\. I was surprised I couldn’t find a diary entry on the topic\.  Scanning my photos I found it happened in 2014 before I was properly practiced at writing in this diary\.  

From 11th May 2014, flight NH943 to   ムンバイ
Lots of photos \- check them out\. 

Château Mercian Nitsuru Chardonnay 2006
Nitsuru, Fukushima
シャトー・メルシャン・新鶴・シャルドネ 2006
新鶴、福島

Citrus notes include grapefruit and lemon\.
A gentle, calm wine rich in fruit\. A supple, well\-balanced finish is one of the many charms of this white wine in Japan's renowned Mercian flagship series\.
Chardonnay

グレープフルーツやレモンのような柑橘系の香り。
果実味が豊かで、優しく穏やかな味わいです。
しなやかでバランスよい仕上がりが何よりもの魅力。
各国のコンクールで高い評価を獲得している
メルシャンのフラッグシップ・シリーズの白ワインです。
シャルドネ

![](dayone-moment://F98C2F80845541C8A847546A30BCC0A3)

entries.richText:
{"contents":[{"attributes":{"line":{"header":1,"identifier":"3AA5DA56-47E5-4C71-BFAD-CE696A279023"}},"text":"Aloha 
"},{"text":"It’s a Friday night and I’ve had a few beers after work here in 2024. 

Thankfully I got to Victoria just in time to make the 20:11 and I’m on my way home.  While I was walking through the train I recalled a Hawaiian moment.  How I got to this moment I don’t know but. ...

December 2017, family holiday to Hawaii and more specifically Maui.  

Our first night was spent at a smart hotel.  

We arrived on Maui, rented a car and drove into the unknown to find our lodging for the night.  

When we arrived at a smart hotel we were ushered to a smart waiting lounge and individually given our own Lei necklace.  
This was odd because we hadn’t paid any premium and were on the cheapest tier possible.  This was lost on the hotel who lavished us with a warm welcome.  

After a prolonged confusion the hotel staff realised their mistake (that we were in the cheap seats) and somehow had to evict us from the executive suite.   


"}],"meta":{"created":{"platform":"com.bloombuilt.dayone-ios","version":2457},"small-lines-removed":true,"version":1}}
entries.text:
# Aloha 
It’s a Friday night and I’ve had a few beers after work here in 2024\. 

Thankfully I got to Victoria just in time to make the 20:11 and I’m on my way home\.  While I was walking through the train I recalled a Hawaiian moment\.  How I got to this moment I don’t know but\. \.\.\.

December 2017, family holiday to Hawaii and more specifically Maui\.  

Our first night was spent at a smart hotel\.  

We arrived on Maui, rented a car and drove into the unknown to find our lodging for the night\.  

When we arrived at a smart hotel we were ushered to a smart waiting lounge and individually given our own Lei necklace\.  
This was odd because we hadn’t paid any premium and were on the cheapest tier possible\.  This was lost on the hotel who lavished us with a warm welcome\.  

After a prolonged confusion the hotel staff realised their mistake \(that we were in the cheap seats\) and somehow had to evict us from the executive suite\.
